page.title: 19CLEATOR MOOR FOR TOURISTS
page.content:
Cleator Moor is not exactly packed with tourists but there are some nice places to go to.
The River Ehen at Wath Brow is very pleasant with landscaping and seating. The water is shallow enough and easily reached for paddling.
Many people climb the nearest big hill Dent for a pleasant walk. There is roadway up to about halfway then you walk through woods and open ground to the top. Of course there is a fabulous view from the top so it is well worth the climb, which is not too arduous.
For those who like the excitement of water there is a ford to splash through near Mill Hill, and the viaduct can be seen from there.
